titleInfo.title: USA v. Hudkins
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendant Retha Hudkins. Because of a possible appearance of impropriety in my handling this case, IT IS ORDERED that the matter is referred to the Chief Judge for reassignment. Ordered by Senior Judge Warren K. Urbom. (JAB)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hudkins
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER regarding motions. Upon consideration of pending motions, IT THEREFORE HEREBY IS ORDERED: Defendant's motion for production of witness notes, filing 20, is denied. Defendant's motions for issuance of subpoenas duces tecum, filing nos. 21,22, 23, 24, 25, and 26 are denied. Plaintiff's motion to quash, filing 35, is granted. Defendant's objection filing 43, is stricken and has been considered as a brief. Ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester. (LKL)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

Defendant's motions for issuance of subpoenas duces tecum, filing nos. 21,22, 23, 24, 25, and 26 are denied. Plaintiff's motion to quash, filing 35, is granted. Defendant's objection filing 43, is stricken and has been considered as a brief. Ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester. (LKL)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hudkins
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER regarding Memorandum and Order45 as to Retha Hudkins (1). The Objection to Magistrate's Memorandum and Order Re: Issuance of Subpoenas Duces Tecum (filing 46) is denied. 2. The Objection to Magistrates Memorandum and Order Re: Additional Discovery or, In the Alternative, Motion to Suppress and Request for Evidentiary Hearing (filing 47) is denied except as stated. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (JAB)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hudkins
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER as to defendant Retha Hudkins. The district judge has remanded that part of filing no. 47, which in turn, appears to echo that part of filing no. 20 which seeks suppression of any "statement and any testimony of Roger Cox." IT THEREFORE HEREBY IS ORDERED: 1. The defendant is given until December 1, 2008 to file a motion to suppress particularized statements and/or testimony of Roger Cox. 2. Trial of this matter is continued until further order of the court following resolution of any motion filed by the defendant. Ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester. (JAB)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER as to defendant Retha Hudkins. The district judge has remanded that part of filing no. 47, which in turn, appears to echo that part of filing no. 20 which seeks suppression of any "statement and any testimony of Roger Cox." IT THEREFORE HEREBY IS ORDERED: 1. The defendant is given until December 1, 2008 to file a motion to suppress particularized statements and/or testimony of Roger Cox. 2. Trial of this matter is continued until further order of the court following resolution of any motion filed by the defendant. Ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester. (JAB)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hudkins
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER-The court has been informed that due to illness, defendant's counsel is unavailable for the telephone conference that was scheduled for today. Ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester. (LKL)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hudkins
titleInfo.subTitle: REPORT AND RECOMMENDATION to the Honorable Richard G. Kopf,United States District Judge, that the motion to suppress, (filing no. 52), be denied in all respects. The parties are notified that a failure to object to this recommendation in accordance with the local rules of practice may be held to be a waiver of any right to appeal the district judges adoption of this recommendation as to defendant Retha Hudkins. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED: The evidentiary hearing on defendant's motion to suppress, (filing no. 52), is cancelled. Ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester. (LKH)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: REPORT AND RECOMMENDATION to the Honorable Richard G. Kopf,United States District Judge, that the motion to suppress, (filing no. 52), be denied in all respects. The parties are notified that a failure to object to this recommendation in accordance with the local rules of practice may be held to be a waiver of any right to appeal the district judges adoption of this recommendation as to defendant Retha Hudkins. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED: The evidentiary hearing on defendant's motion to suppress, (filing no. 52), is cancelled. Ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester. (LKH)

extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER adopting 61 Magistrate Judge's Recommendation and denying 52 Motion to Suppress as to Retha Hudkins (1). Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (JAB)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hudkins
titleInfo.subTitle: TENTATIVE FINDINGS OF FACT regarding Revised Presentence Investigation Report as to defendant Retha Hudkins. It is ordered that:... (2)The defendant's objection to loss 73 and her motion for variance 74 will be resolved at sentencing. Because a lengthy evidentiary hearing is requested, defense counsel and counsel for the government shall arrange a telephone conference with me to discuss scheduling. Counsel shall call my judicial assistant to schedule the telephone conference. The motion in limine 19 is denied as moot.(3)Except to the extent (if at all) that I have sustained an objection or granted a motion or reserved an issue for later resolution in the preceding paragraph, the parties are herewith notified that my tentative findings are that the presentence report is correct in all respects. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: TENTATIVE FINDINGS OF FACT regarding Revised Presentence Investigation Report as to defendant Retha Hudkins. It is ordered that:... (2)The defendant's objection to loss 73 and her motion for variance 74 will be resolved at sentencing. Because a lengthy evidentiary hearing is requested, defense counsel and counsel for the government shall arrange a telephone conference with me to discuss scheduling. Counsel shall call my judicial assistant to schedule the telephone conference. The motion in limine 19 is denied as moot.(3)Except to the extent (if at all) that I have sustained an objection or granted a motion or reserved an issue for later resolution in the preceding paragraph, the parties are herewith notified that my tentative findings are that the presentence report is correct in all respects. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hudkins
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendant Retha Hudkins. A conference call was held with counsel.IT IS ORDERED that Defendant Hudkins' revocation hearing is rescheduled to Thursday, August 20, 2009, at 2:00 to 4:30 p.m. and continued on Friday, August 21, 2009, at 9:00 a.m. to 12:00 noon and 1:15 to 4:30 p.m., before the undersigned United States district judge, in Courtroom No. 1, United States Courthouse and Federal Building, 100 Centennial Mall North, Lincoln, Nebraska. The defendant shall be present unless excused by the court. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hudkins
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER as to defendant Retha Hudkins. I am in receipt of a letter from the defendant. Treating the letter as a motion, the motion is granted in part and denied in part. The government is directed to respond to the defendant's questions set forth in the letter within ten days of this order. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (Copy mailed to pro se party)(JAB)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER as to defendant Retha Hudkins. I am in receipt of a letter from the defendant. Treating the letter as a motion, the motion is granted in part and denied in part.
